result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Brad Schraven is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Schraven heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes an additional $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx.
Deft to contact her atty that is already assigned to this case, Attorney Hansen.
11:25 AM
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:30 PM Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez not in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Deft does not appear.
Atty Hansen heard - was expecting Deft to appear early today - whereabouts of Deft are unknown at this time.
Atty Hansen checks the hallway.
Court checks with JA.
ADA heard and requests a bench warrant.
Requests the trial dates be removed from the Court's calendar.
Court so orders.
2:34 PM

11:39 AM Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen heard - case is not resolved.
Requests matter be set for trial.
Atty Hansen confirms all offers have been discussed with the deft.
Court speaks to deft.
Deft understands.
Parties agree to a 2-day trial.
11:42 off record.
11:43 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
ADA heard and revokes all offers.
11:45 AM
Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:54 PM Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen heard - matter is not yet resolved.
Requests another status.
Court schedules with parties.
2:58 PM
Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in court with attorney Brad Hansen. Prosecuting Atty Kathryn E Heineck appeared for State of Wisconsin.
2:57 p.m.
Copy of Information.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
Requests STC in 60 days.
3:00 p.m.
  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

03:19 PM Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FTR - 03:19
Court calls case
Waiver of prelim signed
Atty Hansen is being heard
Def freely waives 
Court finds def freely waives prelim and binds over for trial
Court schedules Arraignment
03:22 PM
  Arraignment scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:12 AM Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Hanses heard - deft understands.
Waives formal readings.
Requests prelim within time limits.
Court schedules.
9:14 AM
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
09:40 AM Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cassandra Adyne Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls case.
Case is a Branch 2 case, but being heard for bond purposes in Branch 1 today.
Atty Hansen is present for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today for evaluation.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond..
Court heard and imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx.
Court schedules with parties.
9:47 AM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
